unit_learning_outcomes.description: Employ research knowledge and methods appropriate for effective, research-based practitioner inquiry.
Understand, implement and evaluate the processes of planning, teaching, assessing and reflecting over a lesson sequence to determine the impact of teaching on student learning.
Critically analyse and demonstrate differentiated, evidence-based teaching strategies that are responsive to the learning strengths and needs of students with diverse backgrounds and learning needs.
Demonstrate research informed collegial interactions, feedback and professional interactions in learning communities.
Engage in scholarly inquiry and reflexivity in regard to teaching practice of self and others.
Identify, apply and synthesise evidence of practice aligned to AITSL graduate teacher standards.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: TPA and transition to the profession resources and reflection

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission into MTeach (Prim) and EDST8212 or EDST8213 ) OR (Admission into MTeach (Secondary) and (EDST8221 or EDST8223 or EDST8225 or EDST8227 or EDST8229 or EDST8231 or EDST8233 or EDST8235))

assessments.description: Pass/Fail completed on placement (no word limit). Teaching Performance Assessment(NESA requirement) includes: choosing 5 focus students and planning teaching and assessing through a process of reflexive practice.

assessments.assessment_title: Supervising Teachers' Professional Experience Evaluation Report
assessments.description: This report is completed by the Supervising Teacher on completion of the student's 30 day Professional Experience placement (Including the TPA) using the AITSL Graduate Teaching Standards.Â

data.subject_search_title: EDST8240 - Professional Practice 3 and Educational Research
data.description: This unit is a Professional Experience unit for intending primary/secondary school teachers. This unit synthesies students' knowledge of teaching diverse learners and skills in independent educational research. Students will teach in a school for 30 days under the guidance of a Supervising Teacher and concurrently conduct practitioner research to meet the requirements of the mandatory NESA Teaching Performance Assessment (TPA).
